title: How does plastic pollution affect humans? - EHN
body: - EHN How does plastic pollution affect humans? Many chemicals found in plastics can have adverse effects on human health, including increased risk of infertility. Exposure to microplastics, as well as the chemicals added to plastics during processing, harm our health.
readable_content: -Anonymous (2023-12-08): What is plastic pollution? It's a major environmental concern. Plastics are causing significant damage to the environment, with a large percentage ending up in landfills or as litter. The article discusses the reasons behind the proliferation of single-use plastics and their impact on the environment. It also explores the effects of plastic pollution on human health, such as through exposure to microplastics and chemicals added to plastics during processing.
summary:
The post highlights the detrimental effects of plastic pollution on the environment and human health. It emphasizes the significance of addressing the issue of single-use plastics and their impact. Overall, the sentiment is that plastic pollution is a major concern that requires attention and action. 

Sentiment: 0.8
